thread.title: Using empirical reliability tools to estimate the effect of HASS on product field life
thread.title_full: Using empirical reliability tools to estimate the effect of HASS on product field life

title: Using empirical reliability tools to estimate the effect of HASS on product field life
text:
This article was posted on 09/30/2015 Using empirical reliability tools to estimate the effect of HASS on product field life Highly Accelerated Stress Screening (HASS) is a production test process that has become a widely accepted method for detecting process or component changes in a product that could reduce product reliability. It is sometimes used in conjunction with, and often as a replacement for, classical burn-in. HASS uses vibration and thermal stresses to quickly force latent defects in a product to fail or to become detectable through marginal performance, thus increasing the out of box quality and reducing warranty expenses. 
Learn more about Qualmark Corp. Related Articles
